content: There is definite interest in getting a FVIG up-and-going.
I think this could work out really well, but I would think it needs someone to manage the agenda to make it work well

My take would be: monthly meeting with a general agenda and some time for open discussion; a mix of interesting updates, questions about semantics and things, and perhaps some shared infra or projects.
(This is a bit broader than the 'office hours' format I discussed before, but I think it'd work well)
I imagine interesting updates would generally have the form of "we're having this problem -- does anyone else hve thoughts on how to solve it"

Yes, a monthly meeting, with an agenda and updates seems like a good idea.
A bit of video meeting is good - but zoopla-based discussion is also really important because more than one person can talk at once so it ends up being higher bandwidth.
This sounds right
Then the question is who wants to take the lead on organizing it :)
I'm happy to volunteer, though I'd love to have a co-organizer to help show me the ropes :)
Great @Xavier Denis . I'd be happy to help, at least to set up the next call. We can then see from there.
great! I'll start working on this during the week and message you!
hi folks! are there any updates on this? I'm not trying to rush folks, just making sure that I didn't miss some other announcement channel.
no! but i'm posting something todday
just need to finish popl! also #t-infra will be providing us with a wg repo :)
Is there a link to the wg repo? :smile:

Sean Chen (he/him) said:

Is there a link to the wg repo? :smile:

https://github.com/rust-formal-methods/wg

@Xavier Denis could you also add a link to this one from (https://github.com/rust-formal-methods/wg)
https://rust-formal-methods.github.io/

We'll soon add a list of past events and an updated version of @Alastair Reid 's overview of tools.
Btw, I finally uploaded the video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ACqgutP0jXs
sorry about that, I still have no internet at home :cry: turns out my specific fiber cable got cut
and they're going to have to pull all eight floors of it out
@Bas Spitters can you PR alastair's list that you sent me?
I've updated the homepage now with Tools and previous events.
Thanks!
